trans-unit.source:
Display logs from a resource in a running Aspire application.
Examples: aspire log web-api aspire log web-api --lines 50 --tail aspire log worker --project MyApp.AppHost/MyApp.AppHost.csproj --lines 10
trans-unit.target:
Display logs from a resource in a running Aspire application.
Examples: aspire log web-api aspire log web-api --lines 50 --tail aspire log worker --project MyApp.AppHost/MyApp.AppHost.csproj --lines 10

trans-unit.source: Line count must be a positive integer.
trans-unit.target: Line count must be a positive integer.

trans-unit.source: Number of previous log lines to display. Default is 100.
trans-unit.target: Number of previous log lines to display. Default is 100.

trans-unit.source: No running Aspire AppHost found. Use 'aspire run' to start the application first.
trans-unit.target: No running Aspire AppHost found. Use 'aspire run' to start the application first.

trans-unit.source: The path to the Aspire AppHost project file. If not specified, searches for a project file in the current directory.
trans-unit.target: The path to the Aspire AppHost project file. If not specified, searches for a project file in the current directory.

trans-unit.source: The name of the resource to display logs for.
trans-unit.target: The name of the resource to display logs for.

trans-unit.source: Resource '{0}' not found in the running application.
trans-unit.target: Resource '{0}' not found in the running application.

trans-unit.source: Streaming logs for '{0}' (Press Ctrl+C to exit)...
trans-unit.target: Streaming logs for '{0}' (Press Ctrl+C to exit)...

trans-unit.source: Follow log output and continue streaming new log entries until interrupted (Ctrl+C).
trans-unit.target: Follow log output and continue streaming new log entries until interrupted (Ctrl+C).
